title: Portugal (D. Afonso de)
body: He was the first Count of Vimioso and was present at the Battle of Alcácer Quibir, where he became a prisoner. In 1549, with the authorization of King D. João III, he bought the captaincy of Machico from António da Silveira, of which he was the 6th grantee. He died in Africa, a captive of the Moors, but outlived his son D. Francisco de Portugal.

D. Afonso de Portugal: First Count of Vimioso, present at the Battle of Alcácer Quibir, 6th grantee of the captaincy of Machico, died in Africa, captive of the Moors

1549: Bought the captaincy of Machico from António da Silveira, with the authorization of King D. João III
